notes.title: Exploitability

notes.text: Emerson ControlWave firmware images are not signed and only rely on insecure checksums for regular integrity checks. This could allow an attacker to push malicious firmware, remote code execution, or a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2022-30262 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Emerson ControlWave firmware updates can be restricted by the following methods: A hardware switch can be set to block remote firmware download. System variable “_APPLICATION_LOCKED” can be set TRUE to disable remote firmware download. Before installing firmware into the RTU, confirm the MD5/SHA256 Hashes published by Emerson on SupportNet (login required) match the firmware image, confirming it is genuine and unmodified.
